      void Context.monitorEvent(MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message)
      Writes a log message to the l2p system using node observers.
      void Context.monitorEvent(java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message)
      Writes a log message to the l2p system using node observers.
      void Context.monitorEvent(java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message, boolean includeActingUser)
      Writes a log message to the l2p system using node observers.

    • Uses of MonitoringEvent in i5.las2peer.logging

      Methods in i5.las2peer.logging with parameters of type MonitoringEvent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void NodeObserver.log(java.lang.Long timestamp, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String sourceNode, java.lang.String sourceAgentId, java.lang.String destinationNode, java.lang.String destinationAgentId, java.lang.String remarks)
      Each call represents one event to log by this observer.
      void L2pLogger.log(java.lang.Long timestamp, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String sourceNode, java.lang.String sourceAgentId, java.lang.String destinationNode, java.lang.String destinationAgentId, java.lang.String remarks)
      Deprecated. 
      Use L2pLogger.log(Long, MonitoringEvent, String, String, String, String, String) instead. The coupling between nodes and services is softened now.
      void L2pLogger.log(MonitoringEvent event)
      Same as #log(MonitoringEvent, String) without any remarks, just logs the plain event.
      void L2pLogger.log(MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String remarks)
      Same as #log(MonitoringEvent, String, String, String) with context main agent as default source agent.
      void L2pLogger.log(MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String sourceAgentId, java.lang.String destinationAgentId, java.lang.String remarks)
      Same as L2pLogger.log(Long, MonitoringEvent, String, String, String, String, String) with current system timestamp and no source or destination node.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(MonitoringEvent event, Agent actingUser, java.lang.String message)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(MonitoringEvent, String) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(Node node, java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message, Agent serviceAgent, Agent actingUser)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and actingUser can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String) Logs a message to the l2p system using the observers. Since this method will/should only be used in an L2pThread, the message will come from a service or a helper, so a SERVICE_MESSAGE is assumed. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
      static void L2pLogger.logEvent(java.lang.Object from, MonitoringEvent event, java.lang.String message, Agent serviceAgent, Agent actingUser)
      Deprecated. 
      Use Context.monitorEvent(Object, MonitoringEvent, String, boolean) Writes a log message. The given event can be used to differentiate between different log messages. The serviceAgent and actingUser can be set to null if not known. Then this message will not be monitored by the monitoring observer.
